page.title: 17Local Government
page.content: Prior to l945 the Parish Council had few functions. More mechanised post-war agriculture with less labour caused some workers to move into urban areas. Tenants became landowners and these, plus the new incomers, tended to change the buildings, appearance and needs of the area and to demand more involvement in local government at parish level, unlike urban areas. This block is part of the Llanwarne & District Parish Council (Llanwarne, Llandinabo, Pencoyd, Harewood End and Tretire with Michaelchurch), with l0 Councillors and a Chairman elected annually. Meetings are quarterly, with Special Meetings when required. The public are invited to attend all meetings & have access to accounts etc. & contact Council members to discuss complaints or problems.
